qas.question: What could be coupled with an antenna to form pure resistance?
What element would this pure resistance be coupled with?
What phrase describes the process of purposely using a lower standing antenna at a less than peak frequency?

context: It is possible to use the impedance matching concepts to construct vertical antennas substantially shorter than the 1⁄4 wavelength at which the antenna is resonant. By adding an <a0_0>inductance<a0_0/> in series with the antenna, a so-called loading coil, the capacitive reactance of this antenna can be cancelled leaving a pure resistance which can then be matched to the <a1_0>transmission line<a1_0/>. Sometimes the resulting resonant frequency of such a system (antenna plus matching network) is described using the construct of electrical length and the use of a shorter antenna at a lower frequency than its resonant frequency is termed <a2_0>electrical lengthening<a2_0/>.
